user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3 algo3,
                               const char *username,
                               const char *realm,
                               void *userhash_bin,
                               size_t bin_buf_size)
{
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  if (! digest_init_one_time (&da, get_base_digest_algo (algo3)))
    return MHD_NO;
  if (digest_get_size (&da) > bin_buf_size)
    ret = MHD_NO;
  else
  {
    calc_userhash (&da,
                   username,
                   strlen (username),
                   realm,
                   strlen (realm),
                   userhash_bin);
    ret = MHD_YES;

#ifdef MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR
    if (digest_ext_error (&da))
      ret = MHD_NO;
#endif /* MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR */
  }
  digest_deinit (&da);

  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected all parameter uses in the function. No function parameter is assigned or re‑assigned anywhere in the body (there are no statements like username = ..., realm = ..., userhash_bin = ..., algo3 = ..., or bin_buf_size = ...). The pointer parameters username and realm are declared const char * so they cannot be modified; they are only read (passed to strlen and to calc_userhash). The void * userhash_bin is passed to calc_userhash which may modify the object pointed to (this is allowed by the rule) but the pointer itself is not modified. The scalar parameters algo3 and bin_buf_size are passed by value and not altered. All other operations use local variables (struct DigestAlgorithm da, ret) or call functions; none modify the parameter identifiers themselves. Therefore there are no fragments that need investigation for Rule 17.8 in this function.
